item.title: 中国 8 月外汇储备升至 2015 年以来最高水平
item.description: 周六的官方数据显示，中国的外汇储备在 8 月份升至逾 8 年半以来的最高水平，这主要归功于美元的广泛走软。【原文：China's foreign exchange reserves rose to the highest level in more than 8-1/2 years in August, official data showed on Saturday, thanks largely to a broadly weaker U.S. dollar.】

item.title: 彭博社报道：美国将于本月提出巴塞尔规则修订案
item.description: 彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道称，美国联邦储备委员会和其他监管机构最快将于 9 月 19 日公布对一系列拟议银行资本规则的全面修改。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve and other regulators are set to unveil sweeping changes to a raft of proposed banks capital rules as soon as Sept. 19, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 玻利维亚 8 月通胀率接近十年新高
item.description: 南美国家统计局（INE）周五公布的数据显示，玻利维亚通胀率创下近十年来的最高水平，12 个月的通胀率为 5.19%，月增幅为 1.58%。【原文：Bolivian inflation hit its highest level in nearly ten years, data from the South American country's national statistics office INE showed on Friday, hitting a 12-month rate of 5.19%, with a monthly increase of 1.58%.】

item.title: 美国监管机构批准贝莱德 125 亿美元收购全球基础设施合伙公司的交易
item.description: 美国联邦能源管理委员会周五批准了贝莱德以 125 亿美元收购 Global Infrastructure Partners 的交易。【原文：The U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission on Friday approved BlackRock's $12.5 billion deal for Global Infrastructure Partners.】

item.title: 高盛预计欧佩克+将于 12 月开始增产
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）在周五的一份报告中调整了对欧佩克+石油产量的预期，称现在预计从12月开始将有三个月增产，而不是10月。【原文：Goldman Sachs adjusted its expectations for OPEC+ oil production saying it now expects three months of production increases starting from December instead of October, the bank said in a note on Friday.】

item.title: 戴尔、Palantir 和伊利赔偿公司将加入标普 500 指数
item.description: S&P 道琼斯指数公司周五表示，服务器制造商戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies）、数据分析公司帕兰提尔科技公司（Palantir Technologies）以及财产和意外保险公司伊利赔偿公司（Erie Indemnity）将在9月23日股市开盘前加入基准S&P 500指数。【原文：The S&P Dow Jones Indices said on Friday server maker Dell Technologies , data analytics firm Palantir Technologies and property and casualty insurer Erie Indemnity will join the benchmark S&P 500 before the market opens on Sept. 23.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧盟与南方共同市场贸易谈判在分歧问题上取得进展
item.description: 两位接近谈判的消息人士称，欧盟和南美谈判代表周五结束了为期两天的贸易谈判，在一些有争议的问题上取得了 "重大进展"，这些问题一直阻碍着迟迟未能达成的欧盟-南方共同市场协议。【原文：European Union and South American negotiators ended two days of trade negotiations on Friday with "significant progress" on contentious issues that have been holding up the long-overdue EU-Mercosur agreement, two sources close to the talks said.】

item.title: 凯雷投资的航空服务提供商 StandardAero 申请在美国上市
item.description: 由私募股权公司凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）支持的飞机维修服务提供商标准航空（StandardAero）周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：StandardAero, an aircraft maintenance services provider backed by private equity firm Carlyle Group , on Friday filed for an initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Big Lots 准备申请破产，计划出售门店
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引熟悉情况的人士的话报道，折扣家居用品零售商 Big Lots 正准备最早于本周日申请破产，并计划通过法院监督程序出售其连锁店。【原文：Discount home goods retailer Big Lots is preparing to file for bankruptcy as early as this Sunday and plans to sell its chain of stores through a court-supervised process, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 健达保育园重启寻求已久的美国首次公开募股计划
item.description: 儿童早期教育机构 KinderCare Learning Companies 周五在美国提交了首次公开募股（IPO）申请。【原文：KinderCare Learning Companies, a provider of early childhood education, filed for an initial public offering (IPO) in the United States on Friday.】

item.title: GameStop 期权交易时机恰到好处，"咆哮的凯蒂猫 "发布后获利 55 万美元
item.description: 上周五，一个与 "Roaring Kitty "有关的账户在社交媒体平台 X 上发布了一个神秘帖子，该账户是一名股票影响者，也是这家视频游戏零售商的长期拥护者。【原文：A well-timed trade in GameStop's options reaped a handsome profit on Friday after an account associated with "Roaring Kitty," a stock influencer and longtime champion for the video game retailer, published a cryptic post on social media platform X.】

item.title: 谷歌搜索垄断案的补救措施将于 12 月出台
item.description: 美国司法部检察官周五在法庭听证会上表示，美国司法部计划在今年年底前要求联邦法官对Alphabet旗下谷歌搜索的反垄断案采取补救措施。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice plans to ask a federal judge for remedies in the antitrust case over Alphabet's Google search by the end of the year, prosecutors said at a court hearing on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 就业数据公布后，经济担忧重回华尔街视线
item.description: 美国经济健康状况的不确定性正在波及市场，给本已动荡不安的市场雪上加霜，投资者正努力应对美联储政策的转变、紧张的美国大选以及对估值捉襟见肘的担忧。【原文：Uncertainty over the U.S. economy's health is rippling through markets, adding fuel to an already-volatile period that has investors grappling with a shift in Federal Reserve policy, a tight U.S. election and worries over stretched valuations.】

item.title: 消息人士称，淡水河谷、必和必拓、萨马科可能就巴西溃坝事件达成 180 亿美元交易
item.description: 四位熟悉讨论情况的消息人士称，矿业公司淡水河谷和必和必拓及其合资企业萨马科公司（SAMNE.UL）可能很快与巴西当局达成协议，为马里亚纳市的一座水坝溃坝事件支付约 1,000 亿雷亚尔（合 178.7 亿美元）的赔偿金。【原文：Mining companies Vale and BHP , together with their joint venture Samarco (SAMNE.UL), may soon reach an agreement with Brazilian authorities to pay around 100 billion reais ($17.87 billion) for the collapse of a dam in the city of Mariana, said four sources familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 独家报道：Starboard 向新闻集团提交提案，试图打破默多克的控制
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，对冲基金 Starboard Value 已提交一份股东决议，要求取消允许鲁伯特-默多克控制《华尔街日报》出版商新闻集团的双层股票。【原文：Hedge fund Starboard Value has filed a shareholder resolution to do away with the dual-class shares that allow Rupert Murdoch to control News Corp , the publisher of the Wall Street Journal, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道文件显示，俄罗斯将 2024 年石油和天然气出口收入预期上调 174 亿美元
item.description: 路透社看到的一份文件显示，由于价格前景更加乐观，俄罗斯经济部将 2024 年石油和天然气出口销售（预算收入的主要来源）的预测值从之前的估计上调了 174 亿美元，达到 2,397 亿美元。【原文：Russia's economy ministry has revised up its 2024 forecasts for export sales of oil and gas, key sources of budget revenues, by $17.4 billion from the previous estimate to $239.7 billion thanks to a more positive price outlook, a document seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 炼油厂需求疲软，美国墨西哥湾沿岸燃料油货运量创 5 年新低
item.description: 分析师说，上个月运往美国墨西哥湾沿岸的燃料油出口量下滑至 2019 年 1 月以来的最低水平，这是炼油厂需求减弱、利润率走软的一个迹象。【原文：Fuel oil exports bound for the U.S. Gulf Coast slumped to their lowest level since January 2019 last month, a sign of weakened refinery demand as margins have softened, analysts said.】

item.title: Roblox 将在其虚拟平台上推出付费电子游戏
item.description: Roblox 公司周五表示，将在其平台上推出付费电子游戏，并允许开发者通过其创建的游戏销售实物商品。【原文：Roblox will roll out paid videogames on its platform and allow developers to sell physical merchandise through their created games, the company said on Friday.】

item.title: 立法者调查美国零售商是否购买了逃避关税的中国汽车零部件
item.description: 根据路透社周五看到的信件，一个由两党议员组成的小组询问六大汽车零部件零售商的首席执行官，他们是否从一家中国公司购买了可能规避美国关税的产品。【原文：A bipartisan group of lawmakers asked the CEOs of six major auto parts retailers if they bought products from a Chinese company that may evaded U.S. tariffs, according to letters seen by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 拜登顾问称美国就业增长势必放缓
item.description: 白宫经济顾问贾里德-伯恩斯坦（Jared Bernstein）周五在美国8月份就业数据增幅低于预期后表示，美国就业增长一直在以极快的速度前进，势必会放缓。【原文：U.S. job growth had been moving at breakneck speed and it was bound to slow down, White House economic adviser Jared Bernstein said on Friday after U.S. employment figures increased less than expected in August.】

item.title: 法国奥拉诺公司高管表示，该公司的目标是在 2030 年代初在美国浓缩铀
item.description: 法国核燃料专家奥拉诺公司（Orano）的一位高管周五表示，该公司可能于2030年代初开始在美国的一家新工厂进行铀浓缩。【原文：French nuclear fuel specialist Orano could begin enriching uranium at a new plant in the United States in the early 2030s, an executive said on Friday, boosting the company's share of the global market as the U.S. weans itself off Russian supplies.】

item.title: 中国、降价和成本：大众汽车危机的推手
item.description: 今年 5 月，大众汽车公司财务总监阿尔诺-安特利茨警告说，欧洲第一大汽车制造商大约有两三年的时间来准备应对来自国外（主要是中国）的残酷竞争。【原文：In May, Volkswagen finance chief Arno Antlitz warned that Europe's top carmaker had about two or three years to prepare for cut-throat competition from abroad, mainly China.】

item.title: 交易员认为美联储将从 9 月开始降息 25 个基点
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，最近的劳动力市场数据显示现在是降息的时候了，并表示如果数据证明有必要，他可以支持更大幅度的降息。【原文：Traders priced in a quarter-point Federal Reserve interest-rate cut this month, with a bigger move expected at its next meeting, after Fed Governor Christopher Waller said recent labor market data shows it is time to cut rates and said he could support a bigger rate cut if the data warrant it.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会因 Esmark 公司董事长对美国钢铁公司提出虚假收购要约而对其处以罚款
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周五表示，制造公司 Esmark Inc 及其创始人已同意就虚假要约收购美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel Corp.【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday said manufacturing firm Esmark Inc and its founder have agreed to pay a combined $600,000 in civil penalties in connection with a false tender offer to buy U.S. Steel Corp.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔表示是时候降息了，并对更大幅度的降息持开放态度
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周五表示，美国央行本月开始一系列降息行动的 "时机已经到来"，并补充说他对降息的规模和步伐持开放态度。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller on Friday said "the time has come" for the U.S. central bank to begin a series of interest rate cuts this month, adding that he is open-minded about the size and pace of those reductions.】

item.title: Durov 表示 Telegram 将处理对其内容审核方式的批评
item.description: Telegram 老板帕维尔-杜罗夫（Pavel Durov）周五表示，该消息应用程序将处理对其内容审核的批评，并删除一些被滥用于非法活动的功能。【原文：Telegram boss Pavel Durov said on Friday that the messaging app would tackle criticism of its content moderation and remove some features that had been abused for illegal activity.】

item.title: Coinbase 必须面对股东因 SEC 风险而提起的诉讼
item.description: 一名联邦法官驳回了 Coinbase 要求驳回股东提出的集体诉讼的请求，股东们指责这家美国最大的加密货币交易所的运营商淡化了被美国证券交易委员会起诉的可能性。【原文：A federal judge rejected Coinbase's bid to dismiss a proposed class action by shareholders who accused the operator of the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange of downplaying the likelihood it would be sued by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：摩根士丹利因第一共和国内幕交易被罚
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，摩根士丹利已同意支付 200 万美元，以了结一项调查，该调查认定摩根士丹利未能在第一共和银行倒闭前对其执行董事长的交易进行适当监控。【原文：Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay $2 million to settle an investigation that determined it failed to properly monitor trades by First Republic Bank's executive chairman before it failed, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 立法者希望美国应对中国农用无人机带来的风险
item.description: 周五，十几位美国议员敦促拜登政府解决中国制造的农用无人机的使用问题，称在美国农场使用这些无人机会带来国家安全风险。【原文：A dozen U.S. lawmakers on Friday urged the Biden administration to address the use of Chinese manufactured agriculture drones, saying their use on American farms poses national security risks.】

item.title: 新日铁在美国的挫折为日本企业的海外发展敲响了警钟
item.description: 顾问说，在美国抵制新日铁以 150 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司之后，日本公司将更加仔细地审查海外交易。【原文：Japanese firms are set to scrutinise overseas deals more intently after U.S. resistance to Nippon Steel's $15 billion U.S. Steel purchase, advisers said.】
